# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/_cell_widths.py
@source-hash: 7db99ec9eb447478
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:59:53Z

**Primary Purpose:**
Auto-generated lookup table for Unicode character cell width determination in terminal rendering. Maps Unicode codepoint ranges to their display widths for proper text alignment and formatting.

**Core Data Structure:**
- `CELL_WIDTHS` (L3-454): List of tuples defining Unicode character width mappings
  - Format: `(start_codepoint, end_codepoint, width)`
  - Width values: -1 (control chars), 0 (zero-width), 2 (double-width)
  - Covers comprehensive Unicode ranges from basic ASCII to emoji and CJK characters

**Key Unicode Categories Covered:**
- Control characters (L4-6): ASCII control chars and DEL range with width -1
- Zero-width characters (L7-453): Combining marks, formatters, variation selectors 
- Double-width characters (L130, 167-448): CJK ideographs, fullwidth forms, emoji
- Notable ranges:
  - CJK Unified Ideographs: 19968-42124 (L219)
  - Hangul Syllables: 44032-55203 (L253)
  - Emoji blocks: 127744-129784 (L410-448)
  - Supplementary planes: 131072-262141 (L449-450)

**Dependencies:**
- Generated by `make_terminal_widths.py` script (L1 comment)
- Part of Rich library's text rendering pipeline
- Implements Unicode East Asian Width property standards

**Usage Context:**
Essential for terminal text layout calculations, ensuring proper cursor positioning and text alignment across different Unicode scripts and symbols. Critical for Rich's console rendering accuracy with international text and modern Unicode content.
